libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
Activating your Catch Connect SIM is super easy! :)

All you have to do is follow the below instructions:

1. Go to our website www.catchconnect.com.au 
2. Click Activate your SIM
3. Click *Create an Account* (or log in if you have an existing account) and fill out the required information (SIDE Note - when creating your password, please ensure you have at least 6 characters, including at least 1 Capital letter, the rest in lower case and at least 1 or more numbers)
4. Once you've created your account, you will automatically be logged into your Dashboard.
5. Click Activate your SIM once more and then follow the 5 steps to complete your activation.

Please note, if you’ve chosen to get a new number, this can take 5-10 minutes for the SIM to become active after completing the above process. However, porting your existing number from a different provider across to Catch Connect, can take up to 15 mins to 4 hours for the transfer to be complete. 

Transfers to Catch Connect are completed between the following timeframes:
Mon-Fri: 8am-8pm AEST
Saturdays: 10am-6pm AEST (except national public holidays)

For requests outside of these hours, your service will remain active with your existing provider until the next day. Moreover, please leave your old SIM Card in your phone until you no longer have reception - that's the indication that your Catch Connect SIM is ready to go. We'll also send you a notification when the activation is complete :)

name: CATCH CONNECT - INCORRECT PURCHASE RECHARGE - OPTION 1

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: If your number is already with Catch Connect Mobile and you wish to continue using this service, you will be required to recharge the service via our Catch Connect dashboard or the app as stated on our website. New SIM cards are for activating a new number or porting a number that is not currently with us. As a gesture of goodwill, however, in this instance only (will not offer again should the same error occur), we can provide assistance. Please activate the SIM card with a new number. Once you have received the email advising it is fully active, you will need to contact us so we can terminate the new number and transfer the plan to your old number. Please note, the new SIM card cannot be used as if there's any usage from that new SIM card, we will not be able to transfer the credit/plan to your old number/old SIM. Please note also that once we have transferred the credit to your old SIM/number, any remaining credit on your current plan will be lost and the new plan will start immediately.

name: CATCH CONNECT - INCORRECT PURCHASE RECHARGE - OPTION 2

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: If your number is already with Catch Connect Mobile and you wish to continue using this service, you will be required to recharge the service via our Catch Connect dashboard or the app as stated on our website. New SIM cards are for activating a new number or porting a number that is not currently with us. As a gesture of goodwill, however, in this instance only (will not offer again should the same error occur), we can provide assistance by transferring the credit from the new SIM card to the old one. This will need to be escalated then processed. Once processed, we will email you and you can continue to use the old SIM card. Please note also that once we have transferred the credit to your old SIM/number, any remaining credit on your current plan will be lost and the new plan will start immediately.

name: CATCH CONNECT - Verification Code Not PORTING

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
You have received this verification code for one of two reasons. The first is that someone may have mistakenly included your number when going through the activation process with Catch Connect Mobile. The second reason is that someone may have attempted to fraudulently port your number away from your current service provider.
Without a verification code, a port cannot be successfully put into effect with Catch Connect Mobile. This means that whoever requested the verification code will not be able to complete the port-in action, as they will not have the code.  This is a new feature we have implemented at Catch Connect Mobile as we take the security of your number very seriously. 
Should you have concerns regarding the security of your number, we recommend contacting your current service provider.

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
Two-step verification (also known as multi-factor authentication) adds an extra layer of security to your Catch Connect account. It helps to keep out anyone who shouldn’t have access to your account by requiring a second step in some cases after you log into your account or when you contact us.We’ll ask you to complete a second step after you log into your account or when you contact us and make important changes to your Catch Connect account, such as:
- Updating your personal details
- Updating your account details
- Adding an additional service to your account

texts.content:
To schedule a plan change for an existing service, follow the below steps : 

1. Log in to your online account at https://catchconnect.com.au/home/page/login. 
2. Then click 'My Plans' under the heading My Account', and select 'View Dashboard' on the service for which you wish to change plan. 
3. Then, select 'Change My Plan' which is under the expiry date . Then choose the plan from the drop-down list, and confirm your selection. 

IMPORTANT NOTE - The plan change would be scheduled for the next recharge, so if auto-recharge is on for the service, the new plan would begin automatically when your current plan expires and you would be billed the full recharge price of the plan to which you're changing. If auto-recharge is OFF for the service, or if the current plan already expired, you would then need to manually recharge in order to trigger the new plan.  Please also consider that if your current plan is not shown on our website https://catchconnect.com.au/, then after this plan change, you would not be able to go back to the original plan.

texts.content: The card number on a Victorian licence is located on the back of the licence. This may either be on the top right-hand corner, underneath the big printed numbers on the back in small writing or if you have been issued an address label, it will be printed on there as well. The Victorian card number may start with a letter, followed by some numbers.

texts.content:
On occasion, when you put a new sim card in your device, the device is not automatically set up to access the data on the sim.

To ensure the settings in your device are configured to use the data on your new sim card, please follow the below instructions:

1. Click this link: https://devicehelp.optus.com.au/ 
2. Choose your phone make and model (or one closest to your phone make/ model) 
3. Click "Internet and data" and then select "Set up your mobile phone for internet" and follow the prompts from here

Once you have completed these steps, please switch your phone off and on again to ensure the changes are saved correctly.

name: CATCH CONNECT - Connect to Network Manually (Android)

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
In order to connect to our Network Manually, all you need to do is follow the below steps:

 

1.) Go to Settings

 

2.) Go to Connections

 

3.) Select the "More Networks" option

 

4.) Select the "Mobile Networks" option

 

5.) Select the "Network Operators" option

 

6.) You will have two options, "Search Networks" and "Select Automatically". If CatchConnect doesn't appear here, select "Search Networks" and when CatchConnect appears, select it.

name: CATCH CONNECT - Connect to Network Manually (Apple)

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
In order to connect to our Network Manually, all you need to do is follow the below steps:

 

1.) Go to Settings

 

2.) Select "Carrier"

 

3.) You'll see a list of available Carriers here, and the ability to turn off Automatic Connection, Turn off Automatic.

 

4.) Select CatchConnect to connect to the network.

 

5.) Turn On Automatic

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
When using a new SIM in an iPhone, there may be a couple of issues with how messages are sent and received. This can be quickly solved by following the below steps.

1. Turn off iMessages
(You can do this by going to Settings > Messages > Toggle off iMessage).

2. Turn off Facetime
(You can do this by going to Settings > Facetime > Toggle off Facetime).

3. Remove the incorrect number from your Apple ID and add the correct mobile number
(You can do this by going to Settings > Click your name at the top > Sign-In & Security, Email & Phone Numbers > Edit)

4. Ensure your correct mobile number is listed in the Phone section
(You can check this by going to Settings > Phone)

5. Turn the device/iPhone off

6. Turn the device/iPhone on

7. Turn iMessages and Facetime on and sign in to Apple ID.

8. Try sending an iMessage.

Note: You can also ensure iMessages are now being sent from the correct number by going to Settings > Messages > Send & Receive.

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
If you're porting your existing phone number from a different provider across to Catch Connect or activating with a new number, it can take 15 mins to 4 hours for the transfer to be complete. Transfers to Catch Connect Mobile are completed between the following timeframes:

Mon-Fri: 8am-8pm AEST
Saturdays: 10am-6pm AEST (except national public holidays)

For requests outside of these hours, your service will remain active with your existing provider until the next day.

Please leave your old SIM Card in your phone until you no longer have reception - that's the indication that your Catch Connect SIM is ready to go. We'll also send you a notification when the activation is complete :)

name: CATCH CONNECT - Port Cancellation/New MSN allocation

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

This may take up to 24-48 hours to complete, depending on what is required to resolve your issue. As soon as this is resolved, our team will notify you promptly via email.

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: In that case, we'd be more than happy to offer a cancellation/refund of your current SIM, on the condition that you purchase a new Catch Connect Mobile SIM card with a preferred offer, activate it online and ensure you select the correct number to be ported or a new number first. Once that's done, simply let us know via chat or call our team on 1300 222 825 and we can then cancel and refund your initial SIM.

name: CATCH CONNECT - Port in delay - different carrier

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: I apologise sincerely for the delay in moving your mobile number over to us at Catch Connect Mobile. Unfortunately, we're still waiting for confirmation from your previous carrier that you are free to leave them and come over to us at this time. Please understand that we do need to wait for this confirmation from your old provider before we can successfully activate your number with us. Please be advised that if you'd like more information, you can also follow up with your old provider for more information in regards to this.

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
Yes, you are able to keep your existing number when you sign up to a new plan. This process is called a 'port'.

 

Porting your mobile number is easy! During the activation of your new SIM, there will be a step where you will be asked if you'd like to activate with a new mobile number, or keep your existing number.

 

Please simply choose the option to keep you existing number, and you will then be required to type in your number in the space provided. After this, we will need to verify the ownership of the phone number.

 


To complete this part of the process, you will need to have access to your phone with your old SIM in it. After you enter you mobile number in the space provided, press the, 'Continue,' button, and you will be sent a verification SMS onto your old SIM card (please note if you do not have your old sim and the ability to receive a verification code you will not be able to progress with the port of your number).

 


After you have received this code, please enter it in the 'OTP,' section you will see on the webpage, and also fill out the rest of the required information on the page. Once this has been completed, please continue to the end of the activation process, then click the, 'Activate Now,' button to request the activation of your new sim.

libraries.name: CATCH CONNECT - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
• What device are you using the SIM in? Is it a brand new phone?
• Is the device 4G enabled and unlocked? If you bought the phone via another carrier, it may be locked to them.
• Have you switched the device off and back on since putting the new SIM card in?
• Is the SIM Card inserted correctly? Are there any messages on the screen?
• Do you have reception bars and does the Catch Connect Logo appear? 
• Have you checked if there are any known outages at your address (https://www.optus.com.au/about/network/service-status)?
• If you're only having issues with data, have you checked the APN is set to 'yesinternet' (If you are unsure on how to do this, please let us know what device you are using and we can look up the instructions for you)
• Have you tried the SIM in another device to see if it will work?     
• Did you get any reception bars when testing the SIM in the alternative device?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • When did the issue first start happening?
• What is the actual error message you receive while trying to use the service?
• Are other Optus services being affected in your area?
• Please confirm the SIM number of the SIM card you are currently using.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
Activating your Coles Mobile SIM is super easy! :)

All you have to do is follow the below instructions:

1. Go to our website www.colesmobile.com.au

2. Click Activate your SIM

3. Click Create an Account (or log in if you have an existing account) and fill out the required  information (SIDE Note - when creating your password, please ensure you have at least 6 characters, including at least 1 Capital letter, the rest in lower case and at least 1 or more numbers)

4. Once you've created your account, you will automatically be logged into your Dashboard.

5. Click Activate your SIM once more and then follow the 5 steps to complete your activation.

Please note, that if you’ve chosen to get a new number, this can take 5-10 minutes for the SIM to become active after completing the above process. However, porting your existing number from a different provider across to Coles Mobile, can take up to 15 mins to 4 hours for the transfer to be complete. 

Transfers to Coles Mobile are completed between the following timeframes: Mon-Fri: 8am-8pm AEST Saturdays: 10am-6pm AEST (except national public holidays)

For requests outside of these hours, your service will remain active with your existing provider until  the next day. Moreover, please leave your old SIM Card in your phone until you no longer have reception - that's the indication that your Coles Mobile SIM is ready to go. We'll also send you a notification when the activation is complete :)

texts.content:
When you sign up to a Coles Mobile plan, your account will be set with Auto Recharge on by default.
Auto Recharge can be turned off at any time after you have activated your SIM. You can manage your payment preferences via the Coles Mobile App or log in to your Coles Mobile dashboard online.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
To switch off/on your Automatic recharge, simply follow the below instructions:


1. Login to your Coles Mobile Dashboard online (https://www.colesmobile.com.au/home/page/login)

2. Once you've logged in, click on the My Account option. Afterwards, select the, My Plans heading.

3. Then click the green View Dashboard button on your service.

4. Then you will see the Automatic Recharge button, simply switch ON/OFF and you're all set (Please note that if the slider is showing as green this indicates auto-recharge is on, and if the slider is grey it indicates auto-recharge is off).


Please note, that if you have multiple services with us, you would need to repeat this process for each number individually. Let me know if you need any further help :)

texts.content: International Roaming is enabled by default with our service, and you will be able to receive SMSs whilst overseas at no additional cost prioviding you are connected to the overseas network. However, if you would like to do everything else such as make/receive calls, send SMS and use data, you will need to manually purchase our PAYG roaming pack which can be done via your dashboard. You can view our roaming rates by searching the country you are travelling to here: https://colesmobile.com.au/pages/roaming-rates.

name: COLES MOBILE - Sim Pack Recharge Options

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
As a one-off goodwill gesture, we will use that SIM in place of recharge for your preferred mobile number. But please ensure that in future, you will need to either purchase a recharge voucher from Coles (for the cost of the plan you want to recharge on) or use a credit/ debit card and recharge on your dashboard

The following are your 2 Options:

1. Activate your new SIM in your dashboard now and just choose a new mobile number. That will be active in 5 mins. Once the SIM is active, simply contact us again to let us know and in turn, we will terminate the new SIM and number and then recharge your preferred existing mobile number, without further cost to you


2. We can invalidate the new SIM that you purchased and once that's done (24 hours to complete) we can use the credit to recharge your existing service without further cost to you

Kindly note, also please ensure you leave your old SIM card in your device as your number will still be associated with that SIM card and not the new one purchased.

Please advise which Option you want to proceed with.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: To switch your voicemail on, please call star star 004 star 321 # from your handset. Please restart your device after this. To set up your voicemail, please call 321, which is the same number you need to call to check/listen to your voicemail.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: Please note that if we proceed with terminating your service, your number would be terminated immediately. Once this is completed, the number would be lost entirely, and would no longer be active or available for use. In addition, any unused credit/data you may have left on your plan will be forfeited. Are you happy for me to proceed?

name: COLES MOBILE - Turn off Call Waiting

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: To switch OFF your call waiting, firstly please ensure that the call waiting option in your device settings is turned off, after that, simply dial #43# on your handset. Once you've done this, make sure you restart your device for good measure! If you want to check if Call Waiting is off / on - dial *#43#

name: COLES MOBILE - Turn on Call Waiting 1

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: To switch ON your call waiting, firstly please ensure that the call waiting option in your device settings is turned on, after that, simply dial *43# on your handset. Once you've done this, make sure you restart your device for good measure! If you want to check if Call Waiting is off / on - dial *#43#

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content: That has been processed for you now and come back as successful. The credit will be available for you to use in the next few mins :)

name: COLES MOBILE - Verification Code Not PORTING

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
You have received this verification code for one of two reasons. The first is that someone may have mistakenly included your number when going through the activation process with Coles Mobile. The second reason is that someone may have attempted to fraudulently port your number away from your current service provider.
Without a verification code, a port cannot be successfully put into effect with Coles Mobile. This means that whoever requested the verification code will not be able to complete the port-in action, as they will not have the code.  This is a new feature we have implemented at Coles Mobile as we take the security of your number very seriously. 
Should you have concerns regarding the security of your number, we recommend contacting your current service provider.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Customer Support Responses

texts.content:
Two-step verification (also known as multi-factor authentication) adds an extra layer of security to your Coles Mobile account. It helps to keep out anyone who shouldn’t have access to your account by requiring a second step in some cases after you log into your account or when you contact us.We’ll ask you to complete a second step after you log into your account or when you contact us and make important changes to your Coles Mobile account, such as:
- Updating your personal details
- Updating your account details
- Adding an additional service to your account

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Plan & Top Up Info

texts.content:
To schedule a plan change for an existing service, follow the below steps : 

1. Log in to your online account at https://colesmobile.com.au/home/page/login. 
2. Then click 'My Plans'* under the heading 'My Account', and select 'View Dashboard' on the service for which you wish to change plan. 
3. Then, select 'Change My Plan' which is under the expiry date . Then choose the plan from the drop-down list, and confirm your selection. 

IMPORTANT NOTE - The plan change would be scheduled for the next recharge, so if auto-recharge is on for the service, the new plan would begin automatically when your current plan expires and you would be billed the full recharge price of the plan to which you're changing. If auto-recharge is OFF for the service, or if the current plan already expired, you would then need to manually recharge in order to trigger the new plan.  Please also consider that if your current plan is not shown on our website https://colesmobile.com.au/, then after this plan change, you would not be able to go back to the original plan.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Plan & Top Up Info

texts.content: You can only move to plans that are available for selection on the “Plan Recharge/Change” webpage. If you move from an older plan (one not available for new customers), you can not move back to this old plan. Please ensure you check before changing your current plan.

name: COLES MOBILE - Dashboard Plan Change Choose Wrong Plan

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Plan & Top Up Info

texts.content:
If you made an error when selecting the plan for your plan change request, you can correct this as long as you have not yet recharged your service. Simply follow the same steps, choosing the correct plan this time and your new plan change request will override your previous incorrect request.
Unfortunately, we cannot refund you if you’ve simply changed your mind.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Plan & Top Up Info

texts.content:
Plan changes occur at your next recharge, so if you’re on auto-recharge and your recharge is not yet due, the plan change will occur once your recharge occurs.
You can choose to recharge early to invoke the plan change simply by clicking the Recharge Now button (granted you have already setup the plan change prior).

texts.content:
On occasion, when you put a new sim card in your device, the device is not automatically set up to access the data on the sim.

To ensure the settings in your device are configured to use the data on your new sim card, please follow the below instructions:

1. Click this link: https://devicehelp.optus.com.au/  
2. Choose your phone make and model (or one closest to your phone make/ model) 
3. Click "Internet and data" and then select "Set up your mobile phone for internet" and follow the prompts from here

Once you have completed these steps, please switch your phone off and on again to ensure the changes are saved correctly.

name: COLES MOBILE - APN Settings for iPhone (Reset network settings)

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
On occasion, when you put a new sim card in your phone, the device is not automatically set up to access the data on the sim. To ensure the settings in your device are configured to use the data on your new sim card, please follow the APN settings instructions below:

1. Go to Settings
2. General
3. Transfer or Reset iPhone
4. Reset
5. Reset Network Settings

This will automatically restart your iPhone to ensure the correct settings are saved.

name: COLES MOBILE - Connect to Network Manually (Android)

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
In order to connect to our Network Manually, all you need to do is follow the below steps:

 

1.) Go to Settings

 

2.) Go to Connections

 

3.) Select the "More Networks" option

 

4.) Select the "Mobile Networks" option

 

5.) Select the "Network Operators" option

 

6.) You will have two options, "Search Networks" and "Select Automatically". If Coles Mobile doesn't appear here, select "Search Networks" and when Coles Mobile appears, select it.

1.) Go to Settings

 

2.) Select "Carrier"

 

3.) You'll see a list of available Carriers here, and the ability to turn off Automatic Connection, Turn off Automatic.

 

4.) Select Coles Mobile to connect to the network.

 

5.) Turn On Automatic

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
When using a new SIM in an iPhone, there may be a couple of issues with how messages are sent and received. This can be quickly solved by following the below steps.

1. Turn off iMessages (You can do this by going to Settings > Messages > Toggle off iMessage).
2. Turn off Facetime (You can do this by going to Settings > Facetime > Toggle off Facetime).
3. Remove the incorrect number from your Apple ID and add the correct mobile number (You can do this by going to Settings > Click your name at the top > Sign-In & Security, Email & Phone Numbers > Edit)
4. Ensure your correct mobile number is listed in the Phone section (You can check this by going to Settings > Phone)
5. Turn the device/iPhone off
6. Turn the device/iPhone on
7. Turn iMessages and Facetime on and sign in to Apple ID.
8. Try sending an iMessage.

Note: You can also ensure iMessages are now being sent from the correct number by going to Settings > Messages > Send & Receive.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
If you're porting your existing phone number from a different provider across to Coles Mobile or activating with a new number, it can take 15 mins to 4 hours for the transfer to be complete. Transfers to Coles Mobile are completed between the following timeframes:

Mon-Fri: 8am-8pm AEST
Saturdays: 10am-6pm AEST (except national public holidays)

For requests outside of these hours, your service will remain active with your existing provider until the next day.

Please leave your old SIM Card in your phone until you no longer have reception - that's the indication that your Coles Mobile SIM is ready to go. We'll also send you a notification when the activation is complete :)

name: COLES MOBILE - Port Cancellation/New MSN allocation

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: We can certainly look into that for you by escalating a request to our Level 2 tech support team for assistance in allocating a new mobile number to your Coles Mobile SIM Card. This may take up to 24-48 hours to complete, depending on what is required to resolve your issue. As soon as this is resolved, our team will notify you promptly via email.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: In that case, we'd be more than happy to offer a cancellation/refund of your current SIM, on the condition that you purchase a new Coles Mobile SIM card with a preferred offer, activate it online and ensure you select the correct number to be ported or a new number first. Once that's done, simply let us know via chat or call our team on 1300 265 370 and we can then cancel and refund your initial SIM.

name: COLES MOBILE - Port in Delay - confirm info

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: We have now submitted your request to move your mobile number over to Coles Mobile from your old service provider, however, they have unfortunately rejected this request due to incorrect verification details. This means the (DOB/Acc number) provided previously either does not match what your previous service provider has on file, or is not the verification type required for this port. As such, could you please confirm the correct information required to port this number with your old provider and get back in touch, at which time we can try this request for you again?

name: COLES MOBILE - Port in delay - different carrier

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content: I apologise sincerely for the delay in moving your mobile number over to us at Coles Mobile. Unfortunately, we're still waiting for confirmation from your previous carrier that you are free to leave them and come over to us at this time. Please understand that we do need to wait for this confirmation from your old provider before we can successfully activate your number with us. Please be advised that if you'd like more information, you can also follow up with your old provider for more information in regards to this.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
Yes, you are able to keep your existing number when you sign up to a Coles Mobile Plan. This process is called a 'port'.
Porting your mobile number to Coles Mobile is easy! During the activation of your new Coles Mobile SIM, there will be a step where you will be asked if you'd like to activate with a new mobile number, or keep your existing number. Please simply choose the option to keep you existing number, and you will then be required to type in your number in the space provided. After this, we will need to verify the ownership of the phone number.
To complete this part of the process, you will need to have access to your phone with your old SIM in it. After you enter you mobile number in the space provided, press the, 'Continue,' button, and you will be sent a verification SMS onto your old SIM card (please note if you do not have your old sim and the ability to receive a verification code you will not be able to progress with the port of your number).
After you have received this code, please enter it in the 'OTP,' section you will see on the webpage, and also fill out the rest of the required information on the page. Once this has been completed, please continue to the end of the activation process, then click the, 'Activate Now,' button to request the activation of your new sim.

libraries.name: COLES MOBILE - Webchat - Technical Support & Trouble Shooting

texts.content:
• What device are you using the SIM in? Is it a brand new phone?
• Is the device 4G enabled and unlocked? If you bought the phone via another carrier, it may be locked to them.
• Have you switched the device off and back on since putting the new SIM card in?
• Is the SIM Card inserted correctly? Are there any messages on the screen?
• Do you have reception bars and does the Coles Mobile Logo appear? 
• Have you checked if there are any known outages at your address (https://www.optus.com.au/about/network/service-status)?
• If you're only having issues with data, have you checked the APN is set to 'yesinternet' (If you are unsure on how to do this, please let us know what device you are using and we can look up the instructions for you)
• Have you tried the SIM in another device to see if it will work?     
• Did you get any reception bars when testing the SIM in the alternative device?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • When did the issue first start happening?
• What is the actual error message you receive while trying to use the service?
• Are other Optus services being affected in your area?
• Please confirm the SIM number of the SIM card you are currently using.
